intro: Crambe amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping crambe, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that wrap around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Crambe amplexicaulis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
